item.description:
@KyleGut3 wrote:

Well the game most likely does have sensors for this, but whenever you are reported [though i may be wrong], Jagex gets sent the last 30sec-1min of gameplay to see if you were macroing or not.

item.title: Is there anything wrong with this?
item.dc:creator: @Aftermath_961 Aftermath
item.description:
@Aftermath_961 wrote:

When it is detected, you get banned. You are detected by always clicking in the same spot, the mouse jumping to another spot, always clicking the same color, and failing to complete randoms.

Try the script I posted, it’s fixed now.

Read full topic

And btw, thanks for the script, works well.

item.source: Is there anything wrong with this?

item.title: Is there anything wrong with this?
item.dc:creator: @Aftermath_961 Aftermath
item.description:
@Aftermath_961 wrote:

First script? lol.
Yeah, it always clicks in the same spot, and it right-clicks, not left.

Try this:

program New;
 var x,y,XChange, YChange: integer;
begin
 repeat
  XChange:=random(3);
  YChange:=random(3);
  MoveMouseSmooth(353+XChange,97+YChange);
  GetMousePos(x,y);
  ClickMouse(x,y,True);
  Wait(1000+random(500));
until(false);
end.

Read full topic
item.source: Is there anything wrong with this?

item.title: Is there anything wrong with this?
item.dc:creator: @lilshu lilshu
item.description:
@lilshu wrote:

Is there anything wrong with walking to somewhere by doing this over and over?

program New;
begin
ClickMouse(353,97,false);
Wait(1500);
ClickMouse(353,97,false);
end.

Read full topic
